data.event: The Arab geographer Yaqut al-Hamawi (d. 1228) referred to the village as Hattawa and said it was the home of the Islamic scholar ´Amru al-Hattawi.

event.title: was incorporated into the Ottoman Empire in 1517

data.event: Hatta, like the rest of Palestine, was incorporated into the Ottoman Empire in 1517, and in the tax registers of 1596 it appeared under the name of Hatta as-Sajara as being in the nahiya of Gazza in the liwa of Gazza.

Hatta, like the rest of Palestine, was incorporated into the Ottoman Empire in 1517, and in the tax registers of 1596 it appeared under the name of Hatta as-Sajara as being in the nahiya of Gazza in the liwa of Gazza.
The scholar Edward Robinson passed by the village in 1838, and described its houses as being made of adobe bricks.

event.title: 1863 the French explorer Victor Guérin visited

data.event: In 1863 the French explorer Victor Guérin visited the village, which he estimated it to have 600 inhabitants.
